site_name: Former Ealing Cinema Site 59-63 New Broadway
application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description: Redevelopment of the site (following demolition of existing buildings except for retained cinema facade) to provide multi-screen cinema of up to 2,503 sq m, incorporating up to 900sq m other Class D2 leisure space, between 4,509 sq m and 4, 934 sq m mixed commercial floor space (Classes A1/A2/ A3/A4/ D2) at ground and part first floor level, gallery space (Class D1) and between 143 and 161 residential units (Class C3) in buildings of between 5 and 7 storeys in height. Creation of public realm including outdoor performance space. Change of use of unit to the rear of No.49 New Broadway to bicycle store and change of use of unit to the rear of rear of No.55 New Broadway to management office suite. Alterations to and creation of new vehicular and pedestrian access routes. Associated servicing areas and disabled car parking spaces. (Outline Planning Application for layout and access)
decision_conditions: No development shall take place (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works) until a detailed remediation scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended use is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.  Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of occupiers of the new development in accordance policy 1.1(e) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policy LV5.21 of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | a.	Applications for approval of Reserved Matters must be made no later than the expiration of three (3) years beginning with the date of this outline planning permission, and;  b.	The development to which the permission relates must be begun no later than the expiration of two (2) years from the final approval of the Reserved Matters, or in the case of approval on different dates, the final approval of the last such matter to be approved.  Reason: To comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | No part of the development shall commence until all of the following reserved matters have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:  A) Appearance; B) Landscaping; and C) Scale.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved documents and plans.  Reason: To ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied with the details of the proposal as provided for in Article 4 and 5 of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) Order 2010, as this application is in outline form only. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents (including parameter plans) insofar as they will be amended subject to the approved plans and documents necessary to support the reserved matters application(s) required by the various conditions of this permission:  Application Boundary Plan, E1098D0001 Rev. P1 Site Topographical Survey, E1098D0002 Rev. P1 Proposed Demolition Plan, E1098D0003 Rev. P1 Proposed Basement Floor Plan (Land Use), E1098D0009 Rev. P1 Proposed Ground Floor Block Plan (Land Use) - E1098 D0010 Rev.P3 Proposed First Floor Block Plan (Land Use) - E1098 D0011 Rev.P3  Proposed Second Floor Block Plan (Land Use), E1098D0012 Rev. P1 Proposed Third Floor Block Plan (Land Use), E1098D0013 Rev. P1 Proposed Fourth Floor Block Plan (Land Use), E1098D0014 Rev. P1 Proposed Fifth Floor Block Plan (Land Use), E1098D0015 Rev. P1 Proposed Sixth Floor Block Plan (Land Use), E1098D0016 Rev. P1 Proposed Roof Block Plan (Land Use), E1098D0017 Rev. P1 Parameter Plan - Vertical Limits of Deviation, E1098D0100 Rev. P2 Parameter Plan - Horizontal Deviation, Basement Level, E1098D0101 Rev. P1 Parameter Plan Horizontal Deviation Ground Floor Plan - E1098 D0102 Rev.P2 Parameter Plan - Horizontal Deviation, First Floor Level, E1098D0103 Rev. P1 Parameter Plan - Horizontal Deviation Second Floor Level, E1098D0104 Rev. P1 Parameter Plan - Horizontal Deviation Third Floor Level, E1098D0105 Rev. P1 Parameter Plan - Horizontal Deviation Fourth Floor Level, E1098D0106 Rev. P1 Parameter Plan - Horizontal Deviation Fifth Floor Level, E1098D0107 Rev. P1 Parameter Plan - Horizontal Deviation Sixth Floor Level, E1098D0108 Rev. P1 Parameter Plan - Horizontal Deviation Roof Level, E1098D0109 Rev. P1 Indicative Public Realm Plan - E1098 D0110 Rev.P2  Block A Proposed Parameter Elevations, E1098D0133 Rev. P2 Block A Proposed Parameter Sections A_A,  B_B, C_C, & D_D, E1098D0140 Rev. P2 Block B Proposed Parameter Elevations, E1098D0134 Rev. P1  Block C Proposed Parameter Elevations, E1098D0135 Rev. P1 Block D Proposed Parameter Elevations, E1098D0136 Rev. P1 Blocks B&C Proposed Parameter Sections E_E, F_F, G_G, H_H, E1098D0141 Rev. P1  Block D Proposed Parameter Sections I_I & J_J, E1098D0142 Rev. P1  Existing and Proposed New Broadway Elevations, E1098D0120 Rev. P1  Existing and Proposed Bond Street Elevations, E1098D0121 Rev. P1  Existing & Proposed Mattock Lane Elevation, E1098D0122 Rev. P1  Typical Floor Plans (Block A), E1098D0115 Rev. P1  Typical Unit Types, E1098D0116 Rev. P1  Design and Access Statement (TP Bennett September 2013)  Planning Statement (Savills September 2013) Statement of Community Engagement (Camargue August 2013) Transport Assessment (SKM Colin Buchanan August 2013) Archaeological Desk Based Assessment (CgMs Consulting August 2013) Flood Risk Assessment and Drainage Strategy (Arup August 2013) Ecological Appraisal Report (Arup August 2013) Initial Geo Environmental Review (Arup August 2013) Heritage Appraisal (KM Heritage August 2013) Energy Statement (Cundall August 2013) Sustainability Statement (Cundall August 2013) Environmental Noise Report (Cundall August 2013) Air Quality Assessment (Air Quality Consultants Ltd August 2013) Daylight Sunlight and Overshadowing (Deloitte August 2013) Ventilation Summary for Planning (Cundall August 2013) Residential Travel Plan (SKM Colin Buchanan August 2013) Framework Travel Plan (SKIM Colin Buchanan August 2013)  Indicative Floor Plan (Block A), D0115 Rev. P1 (TP Bennett 22/07/2013) Indicative Floor Plan (Block B), D0117 Rev. P1 (TP Bennett 02/12/2013) Indicative Floor Plan (Block C), D0118 Rev. P1 (TP Bennett 02/12/2013) Indicative Floor Plan (Block D), D0119 Rev. P1 (TP Bennett 02/12/2013) Indicative Unit Type Layouts, D0116 Rev. P1 (TP Bennett 22/07/2013)  Draft Design Code (TP Bennett, December 2013) 3 x CGIs showings views from Ealing Green (TP Bennett, December 2013) Inclusive Design and Lifetime Homes Compliance (TP Bennett, December 2013) Site Wide Service Distribution Strategy, 1007830-SK-009 Rev. B (Cundall, 03/12/2013) Sustainability and Energy Clarifications (Cundall, December 2013) SKM Post Submission Highways Response (SKM 02/12/2013)  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning to ensure that the development is implemented in accordance with the approved plans, which have been, assessed against the Council's Adopted Development Plan. | The Reserved Matters submission shall include the following information:  A)	Updated Design and Access Statement and supporting Design Code, which responds in detail to the ten design principles set out in the draft Ealing Cinema SPD and the Mayor's Housing Design Guide;  B)	Planning Statement;  C)	Floor, elevation and section plans;  D)	Roofs plans including detailing of renewable energy measures and biodiversity roofs;  E)	The finished levels of the development in relation to the levels of the surrounding area and the ordnance datum;  F)	Roofs plans including detailing of renewable energy measures and biodiversity roofs;  G)	Detailed drawings of ground floor level shopfronts (where proposed);  H)	Details of the internal space standards, unit-size mix, Lifetime Homes and Wheelchair Standards of residential units;  I)	Provision for accessible toilets, baby changing facilities and changing rooms within the buildings;  J)	Updated Arboricultural Report and proposed Tree Protection Measures;  K)	Detailed design of hard and soft landscaping, public realm, performance space and boundary treatments;  L)	A statement detailing how the landscaping proposals contribute to ecological enhancements and recommendations detailed within the approved Ecological Appraisal Report;  M)	Detailed design of disabled parking spaces and servicing areas, including provision for future Electric Vehicle Charging Points in accordance with London Plan standards;  N)	Details of bicycle storage for residential accommodation; bicycle storage for staff of the non-residential uses and bicycle parking for visitors to the non-residential floorspace;  O)	Updated Daylight and Sunlight Report, including shadow plot diagrams;  P)	Wind/Microclimate Assessment for the proposed areas of public realm;  Q)	External Lighting and security strategy (including secured by design measures);  R)	The provision of on-site play space for children under 5 years of age who would live in the development, in accordance with London Plan standards (10sqm per child).  The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved plans and details.  Reason: In order that the Local Planning Authority could be satisfied with the details of the proposed development in accordance with the Adopted Development Plan. | No development shall take place (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works) until a phasing plan showing how the development will be implemented in a comprehensive manner has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall then be implemented only in accordance with the approved phasing plan.  Reason: To ensure that the development is implemented in a comprehensive manner and, in particular, to ensure that a multi-screen cinema is provided as part of the development, in a timely manner, in accordance with Ealing's Development Sites DPD (EAL6) and the Ealing Cinema Site SPD (Adopted December 2013). | No development, other than demolition and enabling works, shall commence until full details of the foul and surface drainage systems have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with Thames Water and the Environment Agency. The details shall be implemented fully in accordance with the approved scheme prior to first occupation of the development.  Reason: To ensure that a sustainable drainage strategy is provided for the site accordance with policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(m) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 5.13 of the London Plan. | No development shall commence (including demolition and site clearance) until details of the measures to be taken to secure the safety and stability of the retained locally listed cinema facade, have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing. Such measures shall include strengthening and support; protecting against the weather or any accidental loss or damage. The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To preserve the special architectural and historic interest of the locally listed facade, in accordance with in accordance with policy 1.1 (h) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.9 of the London Plan 2011. | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced (other than demolition and enabling works) for the insulation of the building envelopes, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided. The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria.  The measures shall be implemented as approved prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before any development (other than demolition and enabling works) is commenced, to demonstrate that the composite sound reduction index of the building envelope, Rw, will achieve the following criteria with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided:  "	The background L90,15min linear noise level in any one third octave band from 50Hz to 160 Hz, and also the overall Linear L90 level, as previously measured at 1 m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected premises, shall not be increased when the amplified music or speech is played and the measurement is repeated in the same position, using L90 linear over any 5 minute period with the background and source operating together.  The measures shall be implemented as approved prior to the first occupation/use of the development and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from any proposed external plant and machinery, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation. The measures shall be implemented as approved prior to the first occupation/use of the development and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | Prior to fitting out of the gymnasium (if proposed), details of the insulation and anti-vibration works to the floors, walls and ceiling, forming transmission paths with the residential units above shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority, to demonstrate that the works are sufficient to prevent disturbance from airborne noise transmission, and also structure borne vibration.  The approved insulation and anti-vibration measures shall be implemented before the gymnasium use is commenced and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | Before the development is commenced, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, of any ventilation ducts from the commercial premises, which are to be fixed to the wall of any dwelling, demonstrating that suitable anti - vibration isolators and a fan motor which shall be vibration isolated from the duct, so as to satisfy an acoustic standard of not exceeding LFNR25 Leq 5mins (octaves) or LFNR20 Leq 5mins (one-third octaves) inside a bedroom and LFNR 30 (Leq 5mins) (octaves) or LFNR 25 (Leq 5mins) (one-third octaves) inside a living room. The approved measures shall be implemented before the gymnasium use is commenced and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | The fitting out of the A1/A3/A4/D1/D2 uses shall not take place until full details for the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable cooking extract system (where applicable), including the provision of a suitable extract fan, odour control equipment, and a satisfactory discharge height, including a vertical discharge without any cap or cover.  The details shall satisfy the advice at "DEFRA, 2005: Guidance on the Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems".  The systems, as approved, shall be completed before first use of the units hereby approved and thereafter maintained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of future and adjoining occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | Prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, details of refuse and recycling storage, together with a Operational Waste Management Plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented as approved and retained in operation thereafter for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure that adequate facilities refuse and recycling facilities are provided for the development, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 5.16 of the London Plan 2011. | The approved soil contamination remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.   Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for information.   The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.  Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of occupiers of the new development in accordance policy 1.1(e) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policy LV5.21 of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | A delivery and servicing plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved. The plan shall cover the following:  - Deliveries and collections - Servicing trips (including maintenance) - Cleaning and waste removal - Control of vehicle movements within the internal access road and public realm - Management and security of disabled parking - Monitoring and review of operations  The delivery and servicing plan shall be implemented on first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, in accordance with policy 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and Local Variation policy 6.13 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | No impact piling shall take place until a piling method statement (detailing the type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling shall be carried out, including measures to minimise the potential for damage to subsurface water or sewerage infrastructure, and the programme for the works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and the relevant water or sewerage undertaker. Any piling must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement.  Reason: The proposed works would be in close proximity to underground water and sewerage utility infrastructure, which needs to be safeguarded in accordance with policies 5.14 and 5.15 of the adopted London Plan 2011. | All residential units shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (based on November 2010 Technical Guide). No development shall commence on the development until evidence that the development is registered with an appropriate DCLG approved body under the Code for Sustainable Homes and a CfSH Interim Design Stage Assessment is submitted to the Local Planning Authority for information.  Within 3 months of the commencement of the development, CfSH Interim Design Stage Certificates verified by an appropriate DCLG approved body will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  No residential dwelling shall be occupied in the development until CfSH Post-Construction Stage Assessment has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval, confirming that the agreed sustainability measures will be achieved.  Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the development, Post-Construction Stage Certificates verified by the appropriate DCLG approved body will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been implemented. Such measures shall be retained for the life of the development.  Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the CfSH Level 4 shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.     Reason: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011 policy 1.2 (f) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Local Variation policy 5.2 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | Each non-residential building hereby permitted shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good standard (based on BREEAM 2011 Technical Guidance) and make reasonable endeavours to achieve Excellent rating. No development shall commence on each non-residential element of the development until evidence that each element of the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the BREEAM 2011 New Construction Scheme and Interim BREEAM 2011 NC Assessments have been submitted to the Local Authority for information. Within 3 months of the commencement of each element of the development Interim Design Stage Certificates verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  No non-residential element of the development shall be occupied until a BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval, confirming that the agreed sustainability measures can be achieved.  Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of each element of the development a Post-Construction Stage Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been achieved.  Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificates of each element of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.     Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011 , policy 1.2 (f) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Local Variation policy 5.2 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | The development should make provision for the right to connect to a future network:  a.         "In the event of a Qualifying Heat Network Operator (QHNO) being identified by the Council, the Council may serve notice upon the Developer to connect the Qualifying Heat Network to the Development to enable the QHN to supply the heating and hot water requirements of the Development. b.         The right of the QHNO to connect to the Development shall be subject to the following conditions being satisfied: i. The proposed tariff structures must protect the interests of the Developer and occupiers, in that total costs for delivery of the service shall be no more than would have been the case if the on-site CHP system had been provided. Tariffs include unit consumption charges, standing charges, management fees and plant replacement funds; ii. Connection charges to the network are reasonable and economically viable; and iii. A service level agreement can be entered into to protect the interests of the Developer and occupiers by way of a guarantee of system availability."  c.         "The right to connect shall also be subject to any regulatory changes governing the communal supply of energy.  d.         The Developer shall use all reasonable endeavours to agree the tariffs, charges, service level agreement and all other commercial terms necessary to enable the QHN to connect to and supply heat to the Development. e.         In the event that the network is available to the development prior to completion of construction, and the Developer connects to the network, the developer will be released from obligations to install stand-alone CHP heating or cooling plant. f.          In the event that the network is not available to the development prior to completion of construction, the developer will remain obliged to connect to the network at any economically viable opportunity, but it is recognised that this opportunity may not arise until the end of the economic life of the stand-alone CHP heating or cooling plant."  The development shall proceed in accordance with the approved details and the approved sustainability measures shall be implemented and operational prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained and maintained in accordance with the manufacturers specification thereafter  Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved contributes to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.2 (f) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Local Variation policy 5.2 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | Unless an alternative energy strategy is agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority, details of the gas combined heat and power facility, which shall provide no less than 30kWe/44kWth capacity including:  a) its location; specification and operation/management strategy; b) flue location, height and design; and  c) the method of how the facility shall be designed to allow for the future connection to any decentralised heating and hot water network;  shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any commencement of works on site and the facility shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the first dwelling within the development hereby approved.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and shall be maintained as such thereafter for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.2 (f) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Local Variation policy 5.2 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | The 50sq m dedicated space (gross internal area) for gas boilers and CHP engine, out of 250sqm sized plant room, hereby approved shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter serve all dwellings within the development.  Reason:  In the interest of securing the centralised energy centre for the site and its sustainable connection to the development in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.2 (f) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Local Variation policy 5.2 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | Details of the scheme of photovoltaic panels, which shall provide for no less than 14.4kWp (equivalent to 1.7% on-site C02 reduction) as detailed within the Energy Statement (Rev C) prepared by Cundall, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the practical completion of the development. The approved photovoltaic scheme shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development. The details shall include:  a) The resulting scheme, machinery/apparatus location, specification and operational details; Should, following further assessment, the approved renewable energy option be found to be no-longer suitable:  b) A revised scheme of renewable energy provision, which shall provide for no less than 1.7% onsite C02 reduction, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the practical completion of the development.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter.  Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.2 (f) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Local Variation policy 5.2 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | Upon final completion of the development, suitable devices for the monitoring of the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment. The installation of the monitoring devices and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications.  Reason:  To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.2 (f) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Local Variation policy 5.2 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | The scheme shall provide a cinema of no less than 1,603 sq m GIA (not including ancillary floorspace).  Reason: In accordance with policy EAL6 of Ealing's Development Sites DPD (2013). | The insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the residential dwellings shall be sufficient to ensure that an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), or NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use.  Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | 10% of the residential units shall be provided to Wheelchair Adaptable / Wheelchair Accessible Standards and such provision shall be provided across a mix of units and tenures within the development. The details of such provision shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in accordance with the requirements of condition 4 of this permission. The Wheelchair Accessible / Wheelchair Adaptable units shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development.  Reason:  To provide housing opportunities for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with policies: 3.5, 3.8, and 3.9 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy and Local Variation policy 3.5 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any of the buildings containing flats hereby permitted.  Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the buildings in the interests of visual amenity in accordance
